dt: {bc}of, relating to, or constituting the tropical New World biogeographic region that extends south, east, and west from the central plateau of Mexico

et: Introduced, along with {et_link|nearctic|Nearctic}, {et_link|ethiopian:2|Ethiopian:2}, and {et_link|palearctic|Palearctic}, by the British zoologist Philip Sclater (1829-1913) in "On the general Geographical Distribution of the Members of the Class Aves [read June 16th, 1857]," in {it}Journal of the Proceedings of the Linnean Society, Zoology,{/it} vol. 2 (1858), pp. 130-45.
shortdef: of, relating to, or constituting the tropical New World biogeographic region that extends south, east, and west from the central plateau of Mexico
